newsitem.title: USA: Salomon retail index shows 7.2 pct January rise.
newsitem.headline: Salomon retail index shows 7.2 pct January rise.

text.p: Salomon Brothers said Thursday its same-store sales growth index registered a 7.2 percent gain in January, compared with a 1.7 percent rise a year earlier.
Salomon Brothers said its index for December showed a 6.1 percent gain.
"January sales were positively impacted by an improved overall macroeconomic environment, more seasonal weather, and relatively easy comparisons," Salomon Brothers said in a statement.
January is known as a month of promotions to clear out merchandise and make room for new spring items, but Salomon Brothers noted strong inventory controls among most retailers.

"While we expect some divergence by subsector, on balance we believe that minimal levels of discounting and strong inventory and expense controls will lead to generally favorable fourth-quarter earnings for the major retailers," it said.
Salomon Brothers said it sees the recent general underperformance of retail stocks in comparison to the overall market as providing buying opportunities in select issues.
